reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed 4 nights beginning of April and was blown away by the huge sunny terrace with beautiful view of the ocean and the church dome. Lots of storage space, nice bathroom, TV, friendly service. Great location close to all shops, delis, beach, and you can walk out the door, head straight up the steep steps for a hike to the tiny village of Montepertuso.
reviews.title: Best value, best sunny & big terrance, wonderful owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No frills but really charming and super well located B&B in chic Positano. Great value, lovely rooms/views, helpful owners. Wish we could have stayed longer. Parking is tough but there is a garage up the road that the owners recommend. If you are looking to see Amalfi Coast / Positano at good value, this is probably THE place to do it. Note that the reservation requires a cheque snail-mailed in advance to the owners, but this just counts as no-show insurance, and is cashed and returned to you once you show and pay for the stay. Old school, but that adds to the charm.
reviews.title: Hidden gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent place with people that care. We had an issue with British Airways during the volcano and the strike, and Francesca let us use their phone for almost an hour trying to reschedule our flight back - even at the risk of missing incoming reservation calls. So if you have a problem, they will do their best to help. Nice to know when in a foreign country.
reviews.title: Ideal Spot in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had recommended a local taxi service to pick us up from the Naples train station, but since we were traveling across Italy to get there that day we could not be positive of an arrival time. So we took the local train from Naples to Sorrento despite the cautious tone of Rick Steves. It was a ride with few views and abundant graffiti. We had no problem - the train had a policeman posted and the crowd friendly. A trip I would not want to take after dark, though. Then we took the amazing bus ride from Sorrento to Positano. Some find that unnerving but having lived near the Rocky Mountains not a big deal. Buses pass slower cars with abandon, but in this vehicular ballet the oncoming traffic knows to yield.
reviews.title: Absolutely lovely - gorgeous views, great hosts, clean, and breakfast on the balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Though close to the beach, La Tavolozza is still a bit of a walk down to the sea and back up through a gauntlet of shops. Not bad, but if doing several times a day it can be a bit tiring. Still, it is a much shorter walk than most. One can not escape the slopes in Positano - nearby Amalfi is much more friendly for those that are slope adverse.
reviews.title: Most enjoyable accomodations during our 3 week trip to Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our two-week trip, we stayed at a number of 4-star hotels. This small B&B was by far our favorite. Celeste and daughters were extremely friendly, helpful, and had great recommendations. Positano was too touristy for our taste, but the views and food are unforgettable. They let us stay in the apartment for a great price (we got the Rick Steve's price), since there were three of us, which was very spacious, clean, and had a fantastic view. What a find!
reviews.title: Favorite place to stay during our two-week trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at La Tavolozza as a result of the reviews we read on Tripadvisor. We were extremely pleased with this choice. Celeste and Francesca were exceptional hosts. The room was large and clean and had the best view ever. In the morning, you may order breakfast - a full continental breakfast for 11 euros each or a cappuccino and croissant for 4.50 euros each. Must try the fresh orange juice as well.
reviews.title: A Jewel in Positano
Gorgeous view from large terrace - what more can you ask for?
reviews.text: The hospitality we received combined with the great location of La Tavolozza certainly made our vacation more wonderful than we could have imagined. I would certainly stay at La Tavolozza again.

reviews.title: A ferryland in Italy
reviews.text: We were clearly in Positano at a very good time because the B&B did not appear to be too busy when we were there and we were able to get a lovely, spacious and clean room as well as a beautiful bathroom with painted tiles around a large tub and plenty of space as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part though was the terrace, which provided us with great views of Positano, the sea and the mountains. We opted out of the extra charge for breakfast so that we could enjoy our own improvised breakfast on the terrace. We only stayed here for two nights, but I would have been happy to stay much longer as I enjoyed the comfort and beautiful views of our B&B as well as the easy access to the 'center' of town with shops, cafes and restaurants (down the street and around the corner and you'll be on the beach in about 7 minutes). I also found that the people of Positano were generally quite lovely and warm, even though they must see tens of thousands of tourists every season.
reviews.title: Celeste is the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the small, family run hotel. While it isn’t swanky, this place makes up for it with a wonderful charm, a convenient location, gorgeous views and affordable prices. The family was absolutely wonderful. They chatted and joked with us, made reservations and recommendations for us and even helped us make phone calls with our calling card.
reviews.title: Perfect Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in two different rooms because of the availability. The first room was on the level you enter the hotel on, Room One. The second room was on the bottom floor, Room 7. We liked Room One better because it had a nicer view. But the view was nice either way. Both rooms had air conditioning and private baths.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Each morning we walked to a deli just down the stairs from La Tavolozza to grab fresh fruit, yogurt and croissants for breakfast. We ate on our wonderful balcony every morning…just savoring the view.
reviews.title: Great location, great price, great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our time in magical Positano. We would return and stay at La Tavolozza.
reviews.title: Comfortable B&B in agreat location with very friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed, along with my husband, at the Residence la Tavolozza in mid September. It was the best part of our trip throughout Italy! Positano is amazing and was largely due to our accomodations. We awoke each morning to a hot cappuccino served by one of Celeste's family members. We would sit out on our patio in awe of our amazing view of the Amalfi Coast in front of us. The entire family work as one at this charming bed and breakfast. They are always willing to help with anything you may need either big or small. Positano is the place to take advantage of a B&B like this and kleave the fancy hotels for Rome, Florence etc.. We cannot wait to return!! Thank you Celeste, Francesca and Paola.
reviews.title: Breathtaking view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here two nights and shared room 8 with my mother. There is plenty of built in storage and a large closet. The entry to the room is at the end of an exterior pathway so it becomes like a patio. From the bathroom window and the french doors you can see the northern side of Positano. The room had a queen bed and was very spacious. The bathroom was covered in green tile and had a full tub with a hand held shower faucet. The family that runs the hotel was very helpful and welcoming. My aunt and cousin stayed in a small apartment. They had a full kitchen except the stove did not work. We were told about this at the time of our reservation and did not need the use of a stove. There was a seperate bedroom with a separate living room with a dining table. There was a very large patio with partial views of the sea and Positano. There is no internet access at the hotel. Being in the ravine, Positano doe not really get access. There is an internet cafe down by the beach.
reviews.title: Lovely family run hotel
Fantastic
reviews.text: We had awonderful stay at Residence La Tavolozza. Celeste and her daughters were so welcoming. Our bedroom for three was spacious, clean and was complimented by a lovely sitting room that enabled us to share a bottle of wine and take in the magnificent views of Positano. This extra room was fantastic and made our stay so much more enjoyable. My husband has coeliac disease and Celeste was able to point us in the right direction for food that catered to his needs. The resturants in Positano were also very aware of Coeliac disease and he was even able to have some gluten free pasta at various restaurants Tommaso (O.A.SI AutoServizi) our driver picked us from the airport and delivered us to the door of Resisdence La Tavolozza. He also did the return trip to Naples at the end of our stay. In between he drove us to Pompei and organised a guide (Marcello) for us which I thoroughly recommend. We also took a boat trip with Salavtore (L'Uomo e il Mare) to Capri which was fabulos. I highly recommend Residence La Tavolozza and Positanto to anyone going to this lovely part of the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Residence La Tavolozza in June of 2010 and had an amazing time! The proprietors were extremely kind and prepared the most delicious cappuccinos every morning. We stayed in room #5 and had the best views of Positano. Our bathroom was across the hall from our room but it was a private bathroom and the location did not bother us. The location is great because it's close to the beach and the main road. Overall we would recommend this hotel and would stay there again!
reviews.title: Picture Perfect Views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: My sister and I sayed in this residence house and experienced a positive stay at all levels. The location is perfect, not far from the beach, yet beautiful view from our private terrace. Pay extra amount for the breakfast. It is quality- pastries, juice, great coffee, served on your terrace or in your room 5 minutes after ordering. Celeste and her family go out of their way to make your experience very pleasant.
reviews.title: You will love this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely return.
reviews.title: Spectacular View of city, great location, friendly staff, very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are in Positano, definitely stay here. When my husband and I got there and saw the view we debated even leaving our balcony and going to the beach! The rooms were very comfortable and super clean. The family that runs the hotel is amazing and very helpful. -- I also recommend getting the homemade croissants for breakfast! I guarantee if you stay here you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Amazing people, amazing value, amazing view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a double room at 90 Euros per night for the second week of June 2010 – absolutely the best location in Positano we could have chosen. Residence La Tavolozza has been a successful family-run business for the past fifty-five years. The family members were welcoming and eager to please, and simply could not do enough to ensure our stay was perfect. Our room was immaculate with a gorgeous terrace overlooking the lower town, beach, and Mediterranean. The roomy terrace with its ceramic-topped table, beautiful flowers and view tempted us to eat in a number of times. La Tavolozza’s peaceful location is ideal, just a short walk from the town center. Upon request, and at a slight charge, a fabulous continental breakfast is available, consisting of the most wonderful home-baked giant croissants, cappuccino and fresh-squeezed orange juice – absolute heaven. Anything we needed, we only had to ask (for example, hairdryer, kitchen utensils, etc.) We will never forget the kindness of Celeste and her lovely sister, Francesca, Paola, and Mario, and definitely plan to return in the future.
reviews.title: Peaceful, Picturesque Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Francesca and Celeste made our stay at Residence La Tavolozza a memorable one. They are helpful and make you feel welcome. Out of the 5 B & B's we stayed in while in Italy this one by FAR had the best balcony. You've got great views of the town of Positano and the Tyrrhenian Sea. It's a little tricky to get in touch with the B & B(no website that i could find), but it's well worth the effort. anyone who has stayed there would be able to give their contact email.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: Late flight Istanbul to Rome. Short night in hotel near Termini station. Crowded ES train Rome to Salerno. Pleasant boat ride Salerno to Positano. Moderate hike up the hill to La Tavolozza. Warm greeting from Celeste and Francesca. Good sized room that opens up to a large terrace and a stunning view of Positano. Sat out on the terrace and watched the boats in the busy harbour. Stayed for 5 nights, tried to extend for 6. Lots of restaurants and shops close by. Very relaxing. Thanks to the entire family for an enjoyable week on the Amalfi coast.
reviews.title: Late flight Istanbul to Rome. Short night...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From reservation to check out, we were treated like family. Beautiful terrace with an ocean view, super clean rooms and the friendliest hosts you will ever find. And the location was walking distance to everything. I would stay here again without question and recommend it to anyone. Its a find and I have stayed in many places around the world.
reviews.title: Simply Divine Start to Our Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Positano is a charming town and La Tavolazza most definately deserves the number one rating. Our room was perfect and Celeste and her daughters were superb. Service is always an important part of your vacation experience and this family has mastered it. We arrived in Positano from Rome by Marozzi bus and walked with our luggage to the B&B. Upon arrival our host was more than gracious and gave us some background information and details about the town. Our room had no TV and I thought nothing of it when I made the reservation. When a "very Important" soccer match was scheduled one night, Paola quickly found a restaurant that was showing the match so we would not miss it. If you are scanning reviews trying to decide, choose La Tavolazza, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views and Outstanding Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip -- if you are taking the Bus from Sorrento, make sure you get off at the SECOND bus stop in Positano, as the first one is alllll the way at the top of the hill and is about a 30 minute walk, which we found out the hard way :)
reviews.title: Fantastic views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For 115 euro a night we had a double bedroom, with veranda, satellite, air conditioning and refrigerator, a private bathroom inside and a terrace with a sea-view. The view and the room were fantastic. Only downsides -- no hair dryer and a fairly hard bed. Beyond that -- no issues whatsoever, as the service was outstanding!
reviews.title: AWESOME FAMILY RUN B&B - ABSOLUTELY FAULTLESS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was my second stay in only two years at this lovely family run bed and breakfast. This time, I stayed with my sister and two cousins. We stayed in rooms 4 and 5, I believe. It's the level with the adjoining terraces and the private bathrooms across the hall.
reviews.title: Another Amazing Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience...which I anticipated based on my past experience. Celeste, Paola, Francesca and their brother were just as warm as they were last time. They helped us make calls with our calling card, set up restaurant reservations and made sure we made our transportation connections on time. I can't complain. The beds were comfortable. The air conditioning worked great. The showers were amazing...though be prepared for no shower curtains in Italy. The french doors leading to the terrace are shaded to provide darkness if you want to sleep in. They also have glass inserts for you to close the doors and still enjoy the view.
reviews.title: This is where you stay when you're in Positano!
The most unbelievable place to stay - THE BEST!!!!
reviews.text: We loved eating meals on the gorgeous terrace and soaking up the wonderful view. Since they were connected, we just went from terrace to terrace. One night, we left the doors open and could hear a singer and musicians at a nearby piano bar. Just amazing as you watched the twinkling lights of Perfect Picturesque Positano.

reviews.title: Lovely View and Lovely Hosts
reviews.text: We did have some ants while we were there, but we alerted them and they came and sprayed the area. They literally came as soon as we hung up the phone. It wasn't a big deal to us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My cousin had an upset stomach while we were there and the family from La Tavolozza checked on her often and asked her repeatedly how they they could help. You don't get this type of service just anywhere! I will recommend La Tavolozza over and over again. Hope to see you again soon!
reviews.title: Best place I have EVER stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Francesca, Celeste and their families dedication to their guests is truly the ultimate experience. That is the secret to their success. They treat you like family, only better.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 4, had a lovely view and our own bathroom across the hall which was fine. The 6 days flew by. We will definetely return. We took advantage of their offer to be picked up at the train station in Naples. Sergio picked us up (and returned us to the airport) giving us our own guided tour both ways. He is a gem. THe cost was 90 euros each way and well worth it.
reviews.title: Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot express enough thanks to La Tavolozza for their absolutely perfect accommodation and impeccable service. Thank you Francisca and Celeste for your honest warmth. Our room was FAB U LOUS. The view was incredible. The location was just a short walk from the hotel, as well as the local shopping area. We were also near the beaches. We hope to spend time here again.
reviews.title: All the past reviews are accurate! Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Completely agree with previous reviews. We stayed 3 nights - 1 night in room 5 and 2 nights in room 2. Room 2 was huge with separate kitchen/lounge area but smaller balcony - but we thought better views of the beach and the cathedral. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: wonderful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location; only 5 minute walk from the beach. Private terraces with wonderful views of the city and sea. very friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: An incredible place to stay in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night with Francesca and her mother at this beautiful B & B. They could not be more welcoming and warm to us even suggesting they would cook us a typical Italian breakfast if we returned. I read the reviews saying they treat you like family and was skeptical. Well, they really do. It was the type of place you envision the people of Italy to be like when thinking about visiting. We had a beautiful view of the ocean from our balcony and the location is great. For under a hundred Euro, this was a gem and honestly would have been happy to pay double. Luxury it is not, but homey it is and it was great.
reviews.title: La Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We feel very blessed to have stayed with Francesca, Celeste, Paola, and Theresa -- their warm hospitality and attention to detail made our stay perfect. They serve the finest cappucino in Italy; a splendid start to each day savoring the equally delicious views from our large terrace. We were made to feel like part of the family, not tourists. They warmly tolerated our poor attempts to speak Italian. With the same view as the five star Le Sireneuse and equally charming service make this small lodging a wonderful experience. We will definitely return.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I traveled to Italy with my boyfriend last month and had the most incredible stay at Residence La Tavolozza in Positano. Celeste & Francesca were more than accomodating in every way possible. They were so funny & sweet!. The hotel was absolutely perfect for us. Great location, spotless rooms, a comfortable bed, and our deck had the most amazing view of Positano! I would stay there again in an instant, and would recommend this hotel to anyone I knew. After traveling through Italy for 2 weeks, we decided that our stay in Positano was the best part of the trip!
reviews.title: Counting the days until we go back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from our stay in Positano at the Residence La Tavolozza as guests of the wonderful Celeste and Francesca. We learned of the property through Rick Steves Travel guide and also read all of the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The town is breathtaking and our room (#3) had an incredible view looking down over the church, bell tower and the gorgeous sea beyond. Celeste, her sister,and her daughter Francesca are such gracious hosts and do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. The rooms are comfortable and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 2 small deli/grocery stores nearby where you can pick up fresh produce, wine, cheeses, sandwiches, etc to enjoy on your balcony and soak in the beauty of Positano.
reviews.title: Wow! what a view

likes.liked: — The terrace, the view and celeste and her lovely family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed last week at La Tavolozza with our two adult children and it was great. We were in the Royal Apartment with two rooms and two bathrooms in addition to the sitting room and kitchen. As everyone comments, the women are just wonderful and helpful. Celeste arranged for our anniversary dinner at Le Siranuse (special treat) and we were presented with a cake! There aren't any hair dryers, but now that I think of it, I probably just needed to ask for one. I highly recommend this hotel. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Simply fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently visited Positano for the second time in two years and had a wonderful visit. This “Hotel” was cared for by the mother and her two daughters, who could not have been nicer and more attentive. We stayed in the apartment with my two adult kids and it was ideal. Close to the town center and a huge balcony. Best bargain in town.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the women that run this hotel are the nicest. People. Ever. Seriously, they made us feel very cared for. They also had the best recommendations for food, and as for the view from our small terrace--we couldn't get enough of it. La Tavolozza is the perfect distance from the beach, since you don't get the noise, and it gives you a little walk to stretch your legs. Positano itself is one of the best places we've ever been, the perfect end to our Italian honeymoon. We had big plans of going to Capri, etc, but never made it away from Positano. We had to tear ourselves away from the place. La Tavolozza made it even better. Even though we had booked a bit late and didn't have a bathroom in our room (it was a private one across the hall), we would go back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Celeste, Francesca and Paola are the most lovely and gracious hosts we have ever met... and you will ever meet should you be lucky enough to stay at La Tavolozza. On a recommendation from my parents who have stayed here several times, Yvonne and I enjoyed a few short days in Positano and this wonderful place was a great home base for our adventures on the Amalfi Coast. You couldn't find a cleaner place. You would never know what a gem La Tavolozza is by walking down Via Cristoforo Columbo. However, Those who know love to go to Positan and stay with these lovely ladie.
reviews.title: We didn't want to leave...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Noi torneremo di sicuro!!!
reviews.title: Everything was perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews I read were spot on. The location is great, the rooms are spacious and clean, the staff are all very friendly. The balcony was huge with plenty of room to sit and wind down with a wine after a busy day.
reviews.title: Perfect in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There may well be other very good places to stay but you wouldn't regret staying here.
reviews.title: Great stay in Positino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just stayed in the La Tavolozza, in Positino for 3 nights. It was my first trip to Italy, and was not disappointed. The room was beautiful, clean as was the whole Residence. The family made us feel very welcome and were very helpful, providing hair dryers bottle openers and anything we asked for, It is a family business and a lovely feel about it, that is why it has lasted 50 years. It is so close to everything in Positino, the deli, coffee shop, shops etc, a great position-yet quite and peaceful. I will definately being coming back, so THANKS Mama, Mario and girls.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this fantastisic family run hotel in Positano.
reviews.title: Very disappointed as were my traveling companions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fabulous location close to shops , beach, town centre, and still quiet with
reviews.title: Very negative experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at Residence La Tavolozza in Positano and had an incredible time. We found this small family run hotel through Rick Steves' guidebook. We felt like we were very welcome guests in Celeste's home. Our room was impeccably clean, huge, with a kitchen/dining area, small balcony and a breathtaking view of the sea, church, town and mountains. The price is very reasonable and the location excellent - an easy walk to the beach area, shops and restaurants, parking nearby, and lower on the hill versus some of the other hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Positano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There was always someone available - Celeste or one of her 2 daughters or son to address any needs, and offer advice and suggestions. They are all incredibly warm, friendly and welcoming. It felt like we were staying with Italian relatives who wanted us to have a great time in their beautiful home and town. The optional breakfast was a real treat which we ate in our room while enjoying the view.
reviews.title: Sweet family place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We would highly recommend staying here and would return again ourselves. Very romantic place for couples as you can just relax on a balcony or terrace or in your room facing the view for hours.
reviews.title: Beautiful family run hotel in the heart of POSITANO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will love this place if you just want a nice place to stay with no frills. My friend and I always like to stay at family run hotels like this. The women are the sweetest as can be. They are very helpful with travel information and recommendations on where to eat. We ate at Il Cove for dinner one night on their recommendation and loved it. One tip though, bring your "voltage" adapter. I didn't realize when buying adapters that there was a difference. I blew up my hair straightener and blew out their fuses with my "outlet" adapter! Francesca and Paola fixed the fuses after about 10 minutes of fussing with it. Francesca assured me that it would be fine to plug it in again, so she did and it blew the fuses again! We all had a good laugh at that one when the 3 of us girls jumped from the pop sound! Here's their contact information: phone 089875040, email: celeste.dileva@tiscali.it address to mail them a check or money order for the deposit: Via C. Colombo 10 894017 Positano SA, ITALY
reviews.title: A wonderful Italian place to stay in a charming village!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to the hotel in pouring rain soaked through to the bone! The lovely girls took care of us getting hot drinks, taking our bags and opening our doors the most amazing view over Positano! Massive room with separate loungeroom and balcony... Duck down to the deli and grab some antipasto ingredients before lazing around watching the sunset!
reviews.title: We have a new family in Positano
